url.description: URL Encoding (also known as Percent-Encoding) is a method of encoding characters in URLs that are not part of the standard ASCII character set. This includes special characters such as spaces, arrows or special characters from other languages.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.description:
• Each special character is encoded by a "%" followed by a 2-digit hexadecimal number.
  • For example, a space character would be encoded as "%20" and the less-than symbol "<" would be encoded as "%3C".
